## Description {#details}

This file provides a collection of visitors which walk the (instruction) uses of a pointer.

These visitors all provide the same essential behavior as an InstVisitor with similar template-based flexibility and implementation strategies.

These can be used, for example, to quickly analyze the uses of an alloca, global variable, or function argument.

FIXME: Provide a variant which doesn&#39;t track offsets and is cheaper.

<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end namespace detail</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A base class for visitors over the uses of a pointer value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Once constructed, a user can call \\c visit on a pointer value, and this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// will walk its uses and visit each instruction using an InstVisitor. It also</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// provides visit methods which will recurse through any pointer-to-pointer</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// transformations such as GEPs and bitcasts.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// During the visit, the current Use&#42; being visited is available to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// subclass, as well as the current offset from the original base pointer if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// known.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The recursive visit of uses is accomplished with a worklist, so the only</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ordering guarantee is that an instruction is visited before any uses of it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// are visited. Note that this does &#42;not&#42; mean before any of its users are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// visited! This is because users can be visited multiple times due to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// multiple, different uses of pointers derived from the same base.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A particular Use will only be visited once, but a User may be visited</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// multiple times, once per Use. This visits may notably have different</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// offsets.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// All visit methods on the underlying InstVisitor return a boolean. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// return short-circuits the visit, stopping it immediately.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// FIXME: Generalize this for all values rather than just instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> DerivedT&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ptrusevisitor"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ptrusevisitor/#a564995c967b0a398c32f31a41b4418c1">PtrUseVisitor</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">protected</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instvisitor">InstVisitor</a>&lt;DerivedT&gt;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlight">                      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ptrusevisitorbase">detail::PtrUseVisitorBase</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">friend</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instvisitor">InstVisitor</a>&lt;DerivedT&gt;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">Base = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instvisitor">InstVisitor&lt;DerivedT&gt;</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ptrusevisitor/#a564995c967b0a398c32f31a41b4418c1"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ptrusevisitor/#a564995c967b0a398c32f31a41b4418c1">PtrUseVisitor</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ptrusevisitorbase/#ac5b2513c27d0e8fe9a9214eb9fe99a7b">DL</a>) : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ptrusevisitorbase/#a17dd1253e0ec2090980e7544fea1bd83">PtrUseVisitorBase</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ptrusevisitorbase/#ac5b2513c27d0e8fe9a9214eb9fe99a7b">DL</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;assert</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(std::is&#95;base&#95;of&lt;PtrUseVisitor, DerivedT&gt;::value,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlight">                  </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Must pass the derived type to this template!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Recursively visit the uses of the given pointer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\returns An info struct about the pointer. See \\c PtrInfo for details.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// We may also need to process Argument pointers, so the input uses is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a common Value type.</span></CodeLine>
